posts.cooked:
I think the dark mode should be improved slightly.
At least in my opinion the blue is a slightly bit too glaring.
I would vote for either a slightly darker blue, so that the contrast (white letters on blue) is better, or even replace the blue by a second variation of grey (like many other messengers decided to do).
Dark mode should also be for people, who want to use it in the dark, without disturbing others. And from this point of view, the blue is too bright, too dominant.

Welcome to the community

Does not bother me, but seems plausible. Though I would like to keep the color distinction to quickly find messages that belong to me when scrolling up fast.
(Note: emojis will still be very bright though)
What platform is this about? iOS?

good question!
i use an iphone, and i don’t have any android device at hand right now. but i guess the colors in the dark mode are the same?
If they are not, this is for iOS only. i really like the dark mode, but the blue is just a lil bit too bright for the purpose it’s meant for.
If the blue is the same on android, then it would be meant for both OS.
posts.edit_reason: Automatically removed quote of whole previous post.

posts.cooked: Not seeing any blue in the Android dark theme here. There’s another thread about changing the iOS dark theme’s contrast already, maybe we can merge it with this one.

oh, interesting. i thought the color scheme would be the same for both, android and ios.
if the other thread is about improving the color scheme in dark mode, you can of course merge them. but i don’t find them (maybe i’m blind).
posts.edit_reason: Automatically removed quote of whole previous post.

posts.cooked:
I just would like to illustrate what i mean.

This here is a screenshot of the dark team in signal:

now.PNG640×1136 41.1 KB

And this here is a better solution, in my opinion. the background black is darker and cleaner (i hope its possible to see it after uploading screenshots to this forum) and the contrast is better with the white letters on the blue bubbles - just easier to read.

better.PNG640×1136 54 KB

posts.name: Meteor0id
posts.cooked:
You might also be interested un this feature request which already calls for true black: Restore black background as "dark theme"

I am not so sure about your blue color preference. Just your personal preference night not be a great reason to change that, and the designers may have very conciously chosen a standard blue color which for example matches the Signal logo.

In my personal experience blue light can give a headace in dark light environments and graying it out a little can help prevent some of that.
That’s definitely an iOS thing; the Android app has a different color scheme.

Herohtar:

That’s definitely an iOS thing; the Android app has a different color scheme.

it seems so. I just changed it to ios feature request.
could anyone show a screenshot, how the dark mode looks on android?

Meteor0id:

I am not so sure about your blue color preference.

but looking at my two screenshots, it is pretty easy to see, that the second one (imessage) is much easier to read. The contrast is just better, because signal uses pale white on blue, and imessage bright white on bright blue.
can’t you see that?

posts.name: Meteor0id
posts.cooked: Note that the letters are grey too. Making them white may already do a lot.

yeah, that’s what I meant with “pale white”, but you are correct. grey is a better description.

so actually what would have to be done:

  • make the letters more white, not grey, as you said
  • make the background more black, not dark grey
  • maybe make the blue a slightly bit stronger

shouldn’t take too long, and looking at my screenshots, i think it is obvious, that the result would look better and be easier readable.

i hope they can change that still in 2019
posts.edit_reason: Automatically removed quote of whole previous post.

posts.cooked:
I find the second screenshot more aggressive than the first. I would rather remove saturation to make the blue more grayish. While also increasing the white brightness. I also like the gray background color more than the black one. One design principal is that pure black colors seem unnatural and should therefore be replaced with “dirty” black colors.

And, as stated before, you don’t know why the design team came up with the colors they have. Requesting a design change to your personal preference is out of line, it’s not your call. Even more by demanding that to be done until the end of the year.

Also, didn’t you start this thread by saying the opposite?

tascha:

the blue is too bright, too dominant

klajsdgasjg:

pure black colors seem unnatural and should therefore be replaced with “dirty” black colors

Which, on the other side, isn’t the best bet for all cases ;) :

Restore black background as "dark theme" Android UI/UX
The latest updates made the dark theme more of a grey which kinda kills a lot of the whole amoled power savings idea. Can we either have the “dark theme” be black again or have a third option for “black theme”? Thanks, love the app!

klajsdgasjg:

Also, didn’t you start this thread by saying the opposite?

that was related to something else:
actually i would prefer to have no blue at all in a dark mode. i would prefer two different variations of dark grey, with bright white letters. because that is easier to read. this also has the highest contrast possible. some messengers like threema did a good job there.

the problem of using a bright blue is, that - for example when being in a cinema or so - it can disturb others.

klajsdgasjg:

I find the second screenshot more aggressive than the first.

well, the point is: if your eyes aren’t the best, under certain light conditions you can’t read signal’s dark mode at all.
i have no problem at all to read imessage (second screenshot), no matter of the light conditions. i have no problem to read the dark mode of threema. i have no problem to read emails in the dark mode. but signal’s dark mode sometimes is impossible to read for me.

klajsdgasjg:

Requesting a design change to your personal preference is out of line, it’s not your call.

i can request here, whatever i want to. as long, as it is related to signal. if something happens, is a different story.

klajsdgasjg:

One design principal is that pure black colors seem unnatural

i guess 90% won’t agree here with you, that is why companies like apple, who have good marketing analysts, decided to make a pure black.

At first, I did not understand the point of this threat.
But after WhatsApp has published their dark mode a few days ago, I’ve realized, that chats in WhatsApp are currently much easier to read than in Signal. This only applies to people, who are a bit older (as I am) and don’t have perfect eyes anymore (I write this, before 19 year old kids start claiming here, that Signal can be read perfectly).
WhatsApp is using white fonts on a dark green background, which is pretty comfortable to read.
Signal uses a blue color, instead of green, which is completely okay. But I agree, that it could be a little bit darker, for a better contrast.

I don’t have problems with the colour. However, I see what you are referring to. Probably it would still be easier for others to read on a darker bubble too.

Apple changed the colours of the shortcuts to a darker colour too in ios 13. Probably for the sane reason.

Surfplank:

Apple changed the colours of the shortcuts to a darker colour too in ios 13. Probably for the sane reason.

Yeah, when adding the dark mode to iOS, they also improved readability.
Why not a color picker like Telegram has? It is the best option to make everyone happy.

This is for sure true. When people can chose their own colors, most will like it. And as long as there is one color like dark blue to select, so I would have higher contrast, I would be happy, too.
But a color picker seems more complicated to code than just changing the color to a darker blue, which might take only 2 minutes.
